chapter.title: Binary Package Tracking
chapter.para: Products and updates to them are often officially supported by a company. To allow giving such support, there is binary package tracking. This feature allows checking which exact version of a package was shipped at what time. This feature is often important for release managers, maintenance engineers, QA engineers and supporters.
&obsa; can track these binary packages and offer a database to search them.

sect1.title: Which Binaries Are Tracked?
sect1.para: All binaries which are released into projects providing kind=maintenance_release are tracked. In addition to that, the &obsa; administrator can configure additional projects via the packtrack setting in BSConfig.pm.

sect1.title: What Data Is Tracked?
sect1.para: In short the information to identify a binary, its building place and timestamps are tracked. In addition to that also information about possible successor versions or if the binary got removed in the meantime. If products do reference the repositories the search interface offers also a listing of products which are supposed to use it. Either as part of the product media itself or in one of its update repositories.

sect2.title: Binary Identifier
sect2.para: A binary is identified by the following information which is extracted from components of the file path of the binary:

formalpara.title: Epoch:
formalpara.para: The epoch version (optional, usually not used)

formalpara.title: Medium:
formalpara.para: Name of the medium (exists only for product builds)

sect2.title: Binary Information
sect2.para: Additional information about a binary is information which gets updated when a binary gets added or replaced.

listitem.para: operation, got the binary added, removed or modified
publish time, aka the time when the repository gets published by OBS. This is not the same time as when the release action got invoked.
obsolete time, exists only when a binary gets removed or replaced
supportstatus, meta information about the level of support which is granted for the binary at the time of releasing it.
maintainer of the binary who has prepared this update
disturl, the exact identifier to the source and build repository

sect2.title: Product information
sect2.para: Additional information about products referencing to this binary.

listitem.para: updatefor: the listed products do reference the repository as update channel.
product: exists when the binary was part of a product medium

sect1.title: API Search Interface
sect1.para: The search is provided via the generic XPath search interface. It is provided below the paths:

listitem.para: /search/released/binary/id : short form, just listing the matched binary identifiers
/search/released/binary : long form, provides all other tracked information as described above
